page.title: 11Farming 50 Yrs Ago At Mulben
page.content:
For many years and until fifty years ago, all the farmers around Mulben grew the same crop _ oats.The seed was planted in the Springtime and harvested in the Autumn. Oats was grown for two reasons,firstly because it would grow in the North of Scotland, and secondly, because with oats the farmer had food for his horse and cattle. The farmer's wife fed her hens with oats. From oats, she made porridge and oat_cakes for the family.
As farms became mechanised, farmers no longer kept horses and so they no longer needed the same quantity of oats. Local Distillaries needed wheat and barley for whiskey_making. Farmers stopped growing oats and changed to producing wheat and barley instaed.
